data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Just because you take nine steps right does not mean you go back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow the instructions, you go to turn around. If you turn around, you return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Let's assume that you were trying to walk back to where you came from. Taking 6 steps and taking 4 steps are equal in distance. Returning to the starting point would require 6 + 4 = 12 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To turn left, you must turn right. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Leave is the next direction to go up. If you take 3 steps back, you’ve taken 9 steps and you can’t turn left again to go left again. The starting point goes back to the original destination. So, the answer is Yes.

You start at the same starting point from the one that turned left. The starting point would be opposite right from the one that turned right. So, the answer is yes.

If you turn right at the beginning, you are reversing. If you turn right at the ending, you are returning. So, the answer is Yes.

If you walk in the opposite direction of the original steps, you would not return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The first step is to face forward. The second step is to take 2 steps forward. The third step is to take 2 steps right. The fourth step is to take 4 steps forward. The sixth step is to take 6 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

The first is to take 3 steps. The second is to turn around. The third is to take two steps. The fourth is to take 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

Reverting backward is when you step backwards. People can remember the same things people remember and face forward. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Before you can take any further action, you first need to face in the opposite direction, to face forward, so you take 6 steps backward and 8 steps right. The first step forward is taken, which will take you 1 step backward. The second step forward is taken, which will take you 5 steps left, which is the first step forward, and the last step forward is taken, which is the last step right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps right to return to the starting point. Repeat the first stage 3 times in first order so when you return to start square one, you are facing forward.

In every direction, you should always face right. If you take 4 steps left, you take 4 steps forward. If you take 3 steps forward, you take 3 steps forward. You cannot take the first 3 steps backwards. So, the answer is no.

When you face forward, there is no stopping you. Also, when you have 3 steps right you are only taking two steps backward. At the same time, each step forward is 3 steps, so you take 3 steps right and then 3 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.

The following instructions refer to turn right and turn around in the same direction. It would take 4 steps to turn around and 4 steps to turn left. It would take 7 steps to take 8 steps to return to starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

There are 3 ways to take 6 steps. Take 10 steps, turn around and take 3 seconds, then take 3 seconds. Take 10 steps, turn around and take 5 seconds, then turn around. So, the answer is No.

If you were to take only 3 steps, you would take 3 steps and take seven steps. Turning around would require one turn, one back to the starting point. If you were to turn around and take 10 steps, you would turn around, take 10 steps and take 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

Face forward and always walk forward. There will always be a 7th step left left. Whenever there is a 7th step back, you will always take a 7th step back. So, the answer is Yes.

If you take a backward step, you go in one direction up, not the other direction. The first 7 steps are in the direction you are facing straight forward, not the position you were facing at the beginning. So, the answer is No.

Backward can mean to go somewhere other than forward. Forward takes less steps than backward. The number of steps will change after a move and you may be to a point where you can not go back. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, from the start you will always face forward. The starting point is the location you have come from. If you always face forward, you would return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The order should always be facing forward. The first step in this sequence should be taken on the left. The next step in this sequence should be taken on the right. The last step is the third step in this sequence. It should be followed by the 1st step backwards with the last step taken being the 4th step. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

In the first step, you always face forward. You take 5 steps to the right, 4 steps backward and 5 steps left to the left with one step. Then in the next turn of your walk, you take 3 steps to the right, 1 step forward and three steps right with another step. In the second turn of your walk, you face left, 2 steps forward, 1 step forward, and 3 steps right with another step. Then in the third turn of your walk, you face right and 8 steps left with one step. So, in the last turning, you take 9 steps forward with one step forward, 5 steps left, 1 step right, and 3 steps right with each step. Thus, in the last turning, you take 5 steps right, and 3 steps right with each step. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can’ t return to the starting point by taking 2 blocks of same direction steps after you make 4 moves. If you were to make 2 steps and the other one takes 4 steps, what would you do? Taking 3 steps left would complete the sequence in steps 4 to 6, and the second steps combining like direction would be to take the same number of steps as before, so 3 steps from left to right would complete the sequence. But if you made 4 movtions and the other one has the same direction and number of steps as before, the second steps doing that will complete the sequence in the direction that you made the first steps with, so you have to make 9 steps to finish the sequence. So, the answer is no.

We should always face forward while moving forward, no matter what direction someone is facing. If someone is walking backward, they are going to walk forward and not backward. We only need to follow these instructions once to return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

A person is facing forward. Forward motion is the primary way one walks. If you go backward, you are going to take 7 steps forward, which means you are taking 4 steps forward and one step left. So, the answer is Yes.
